result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelly A. Petrusky was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription as approved by agent.
*  Ct.2 - Pay fine of $2,579.00 and court costs including all applicable surcharges during probation term in Ct.1.
*  Ct.1 - Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*  Pay restitution in the sum of $1,769.00 plus surcharges.
May not have contact with drug users, dealers, or felons, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.
*  Pay prosecution costs of $1,080.60.

supervisions.notes: To be paid while on probation in Ct.1.
To be paid while on probation in Ct.1.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney L Keating.  Clerk/H. Barnett.   State files amended information.  On State's motion, cts 3 & 4 are dismissed and read in.  Deft pleads guilty to cts 1 & 2.  Court finds deft guilty of cts 1 & 2.  PSI waived.  On ct 2 the court imposes sentence of 270 days jail w/Huber privileges consecutive to 14CM894; deft taken into custody from court; $2,579.00 total fine/costs (including IID surcharge), pay restitution of $1,769 (by stipulation of deft), pay prosecution costs of $1,080.60 (by stipulation of deft), bond applied, remainder to be paid during probation on ct 1; 30 month revocation of DL; IID; OWI assessment; on ct 1 the court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 3 years w/conditions concurrent to 14CM894 & ct 2 of 14CF1372; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $250 DNA surcharge.
